Package com.independentid.scim.security

Class AccessControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.independentid.scim.security.AccessControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScimSerializer
    public class AccessControl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScimSerializer
    AccessControl is based originally upon the Sun Directory server aci (access control instruction) model. An access control is composed of 4 parts: - Resources - Composed of a path (required), targetAttrs, and targetFilter to describe the resources and attributes to which a policy is applied - Name - A descriptive name of an aci - Clients - The actors to which a rule applies - Rights - The rights granted such as add, modify, delete, read, search, compare This class represents a single ACI and is invoked AccessManager

        Returns:

      • isClientMatch

        public boolean isClientMatch​(RequestCtx ctx,
                             io.quarkus.security.identity.SecurityIdentity identity)
        Check's to see if the identity provided matches the "actors" requirements of the current rule.
        Parameters:
        ctx - A RequestCtx object containing the parsed SCIM request made by the client.
        identity - The SecurityIdentity provided by Quarkus and the login filters.
        Returns:
        True if the client matches the ACI's actor clause

      • isTargetFilterOk

        public boolean isTargetFilterOk​(ScimResource res)
        if a targetFilter value is specified checks that the resource matfches correctly. If unspecified returns true (as condition is silent).
        Parameters:
        res - The ScimResource to be evaluated for a match
        Returns:
        true if matched or unspecified
